1.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.
A floating sign says:
"--Tread carefully! Only high levels should attempt
this place. Leave messages on the board if you have problems.

exits.desc: There is another cloud above you.  If you jump you might make it...

2.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: There is another cloud east of you.
There is another cloud below you.

3.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: You can barely make out a cloud to the north.
You see a cloud somewhere south of you.

4.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: You can barely make out a cloud to the north.
There is another cloud east of you.

desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: There is another cloud east of you.
You spy a tiny cloud.

6.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: You can barely make out a cloud to the north.
You spy a tiny cloud.

7.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: There is another cloud east of you.
You see a cloud somewhere south of you.
There is another cloud below you.

8.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: An ominous storm cloud looms to the east.
You spy a tiny cloud.

9.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: You spy a tiny cloud.
An ominous storm cloud looms below you.

10.name: An ominous storm cloud.
desc: You find yourself in a storm.  Lightning flashes and thunder
crashes, making you wish you were dry and warm.

exits.desc: There is a crag, high and rocky.
You spy a tiny cloud.
There is another cloud above you.  If you jump you might make it...

11.name: High and perilous cliff
desc: You are on a high and rocky cliff.  To the west you see a huge
ominous storm cloud moving this way.  You might want to take cover
before the storm hits.  You think that there is a narrow trail
leading to the south.

exits.desc: An ominous storm cloud looms to the east.

12.name: Narrow rocky trail.
desc: A narrow trail leads down towards the mountain and north toward the
cliff.  It seems to fade in and out as it winds up the hill.
Obviously, it has not been maintained in years.

13.name: Small valley.
desc: You are in a lush valley full of trees and other vegetation and the
odd carcass or two.  The trail leads south and it leads up.

14.name: Small valley.
desc: You are in a lush valley full of trees and other vegetation and the
odd carcass or three.  The trail leads north and it leads down into
a crevass.

exits.desc: The crevass looks a little slippery...

15.name: Deep, slippery crevice.
desc: The crevice is deep and a little dim and it is hard to make your
way around.  A mist makes everything a little damp and slippery.
Better take your time climbing through here.

exits.desc: The mist looks thicker in this direction.

16.name: Incredibly slippery crevice.
desc: The crevice is getting more and more slippery.  You are getting
incredibly nervous and want to turn back.  To the east is the
crevice and trail you were following.  Below, you can just see the
edge of a cliff through the mist.  There is no trail leading there,
just a smooth, flat, dew-covered rock that almost resembles a
slide...

exits.desc: The way back to safety.
Only fools would dare tread here!

17.name: Steep mountainside.
desc: From here, you can see forever.  Clouds, birds, the forest.
Midgaard is far, far to the west.  What a postcard perfect view!

18.name: Steep mountainside.
desc: From here, you can see forever.  Clouds, birds, the forest.
Midgaard is far, far to the west.  What a postcard perfect view!

19.name: Treacherous Cliff.
desc: The cliff is rocky and difficult to negotiate.  One wrong slip and
you could fall and break a leg or impale yourself or something else
nasty.
Above you is an almost vertical cliff.  It looks dangerous but
climbable.

20.name: Cliff Face.
desc: You are more than a little nervous climbing on this almost vertical
cliff face.  You miraculously find places to grab onto and little
ledges to rest on.  You see a small cave here.

exits.desc: A dank, dark, smelly hole.
A large ledge that looks pretty safe.

21.name: Dank, dark, smelly hole.
desc: This hole must have been used as a lair or nest.  There are
feathers and bones everywhere and the floor is covered with
something disgusting.

22.name: Large, sturdy ledge.
desc: You are on a ledge above a steep cliff face.  You can climb down
if you want, but be careful!  After viewing the scenery, you notice
two small caves here, one north and one west.

23.name: Absolutely disgusting lair.
desc: The stench in here is quite foul.  There are feathers, bones and
rotting carcasses everywhere.  This place is absolutely gross and
you have to strain yourself not to lose your lunch.

24.name: Absolutely disgusting lair.
desc: The stench in here is quite foul.  There are feathers, bones and
rotting carcasses everywhere.  This place is absolutely gross and
you have to strain yourself not to lose your lunch.

25.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: An ominous storm cloud looms to the east.
There is another cloud above you.  If you jump you might make it...

26.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: A cirrus cloud hums peacefully to itself
You spy a tiny cloud.
There is another cloud above you.  If you jump you might make it...
There is another cloud below you.

27.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: To the north you see an angry cloud lashing out.
There is another cloud east of you.
There is another cloud above you.  If you jump you might make it...

28.name: A fluffy white cloud.
desc: You find yourself standing on a small cloud.  The cloud feels kind
of spongy beneath your feet.  You find it hard to see anything in
the distance as wisps of cloud blow over your face.

exits.desc: You see a cloud somewhere south of you.
There is another cloud below you.

29.name: Sleepy little cloud.
desc: This cloud is peacefully snoozing away, enjoying himself.  There
is grumpy cloud to the east and a rather shy cloud north of here.
The cloud to the north blushes and tries to hide when you look at
it.

exits.desc: The cloud to the east mutters and grumbles at you.

30.name: Grumpy little cloud.
desc: This cloud mutters and grumbles at you.  You have to jump quickly
to avoid a lightning bolt that passes by your toe.  Your aren't
sure but you think you hear the cloud snicker.

exits.desc: A happy little cloud is humming peacefully to itself.

desc: A sleepy little cloud to the west yawns and rolls over.  You hear
snoring.

31.name: Happy little cloud.
desc: You hear the cloud humming a little song to itself, but you can't
figure out the song.

exits.desc: There is a pure white cloud north of you.  It is snowing!
You see a cloud somewhere south of you.
You see an angry little cloud muttering and grumbling to itself.

32.name: Bashful little cloud.
desc: This cloud blushes and tries to avoid your glance as you look at
your surroundings.  You decide that overall it is a peaceful little
cloud.

exits.desc: The cloud to the north sneezes!

desc: A sleepy little cloud to the south yawns and rolls over.  You hear
snoring.

exits.desc: An isolated little raincloud.

33.name: Sneezing little cloud.
desc: The cloud is wracked with sneezes.  At first you thought you were
in an earthquake before you realize where you are!

exits.desc: This cloud is, like, totally lost, you know?

desc: The cloud to the south blushes and tries to hide when you look at
it.

exits.desc: You see a cirrus maximus cloud.

34.name: Dopey little cloud.
desc: This cloud is too busy daydreaming to watch where its going.  It
doesn't even notice you landing on it.  It looks like it couldn't
figure its way out of an open box.

exits.desc: You see a very scientific cloud.
The cloud sneezes!  Yuck.

35.name: Doc-like little cloud.
desc: The cloud looks at you through its Lennon like specs and examines
you quite scientifically.

exits.desc: There is a pure white cloud south of you.  It is snowing!
This cloud is, like, totally lost, you know?

36.name: Snowy, white cloud.
desc: You shiver as you stand here.  This beautiful, fluffy, pure white
cloud is snowing.  The snow is pure and sweet as it melts in your
mouth.  What a nifty cloud to be on.

exits.desc: You see a very scientific cloud.
A happy, peaceful little cloud humming to itself.

37.name: Cold, damp cloud.
desc: Your mood grows grumpy as you find yourself cold and wet from this
dismal cloud.  You notice a rock outcropping above you.

exits.desc: There is a pure white cloud east of you.  It is snowing!

38.name: Mysterious rock outcropping.
desc: This rock outcropping just seems to hang in midair.  To the north
you see a house and if you ease yourself down, you can land on a
rather damp, dismal cloud.  The door to the house is closed.

exits.desc: Eerie looking house.

39.name: Foyer.
desc: Shadows play tricks on your eyes.  Everytime you think you see
something in a corner and turn to get a better look, nothing is
there.  The place is very dark.  Even with a torch, you have
trouble making out the room to the east.

40.name: Tower.
desc: You are in a musty old tower.  The smell of mold and mildew is
almost overpowering.  You hear strange creaks and groans...is it
the wind or did someone (something?) make that noise.  To the west
is the house and there is a stairway leading up into the tower.

41.name: Witches Tower
desc: Here you see strange things of arcane value.  There is a cauldron
in the corner bubbling madly, belching a foul brew that must have
come from hell.  On shelves lie jars of strange creatures you have
never seen before, or hope to again.  A cupboard is in the corner.
The cupboard is in the corner.  It is made of teak and ivory and
is ornately carved with grotesque scenes of death and torture.

42.name: Suspicious little raincloud.
desc: On second glance, this cloud doesn't seem much like a raincloud.
A balloon sticks out of the top and you think you hear it humming
something like, 'Tut, tut!  It looks like rain!'

exits.desc: A bashful little cloud that tries to avoid your notice.

43.name: Cirrus maximimus cloud.
43.desc: This cloud looks like it is of the cirrus maximus genre of clouds.

exits.desc: The cloud to the east sneezes!
A suspicious little raincloud with a balloon.

44.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

45.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

exits.desc: The eye of the storm.

46.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

47.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

exits.desc: The eye of the storm.

48.name: The eye of the storm.
desc: You are relaxed and peaceful here in the center of the storm.  The
only problem is, you have to leave sometime.

49.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

exits.desc: The eye of the storm.

50.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

51.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

exits.desc: The eye of the storm.

52.name: Raging hurricane.
desc: You are buffeted and knocked about by the almost godlike strength
of the raging hurricane.  It is hard to see and hear anything.
Your only thought is to seek refuge from the storm.

53.name: Calm cloud.
desc: This cloud is just outside the hurricane.  It looks like it might
get sucked in, but you feel safe for the moment.

54.name: Mountainside.
desc: You find yourself on the side of a huge granite mountain.  The air
is quite thin so you know you are at a very high altitude.  There
is no plant life beyond moss and lichen in this lonely, barren
place.

55.name: Mountainside.
desc: You find yourself on the side of a huge granite mountain.  The air
is quite thin so you know you are at a very high altitude.  There
is no plant life beyond moss and lichen in this lonely, barren
place.

56.name: Roc's Nest.
desc: You are standing in a nest.  It is huge, at least two spearlengths
wide.  You see three eggs in the center.  They are knee high, brown
and look almost leathery.  Better hope mom isn't around!

57.name: Cumulative nimble cloud.
desc: This cloud looks like it belongs to the phyllus of Cumlative nimble
clouds.

58.name: Dark hidden cloud.
58.desc: This cloud looks like the perfect place to hide.

59.name: Yet another cloud
desc: You find yourself in yet another cloud.  Will the madness never
end?  There is a rope ladder leading up.

60.name: Front gate
desc: There is a gate here.  It is huge, towering over you.  It creaks
as it sways in the breeeze.  To the south you see a huge lawn.
There is a rope ladder leading down.

exits.desc: To the south you see a huge lawn.
There is a rope ladder leading down.

61.name: Lawn
desc: The lawn seems to stretch and stretch to the south and to the west.
North of you is a gate.  The grass is emerald green and luscious,
obviously well cared for.

62.name: Croquet game
desc: A croquet game has been set up and carelessly left out.  Who ever
was playing blue was in the lead before they quit.  Benches have
been set up for spectators and players to enjoy themselves.

63.name: Huge, gorgeous fountain.
desc: An enormous golden fountain is here.  You see swans, angels,
gryphons and a host of other creatures in the fountain.  The
fountain empties into a huge pool that looks quite inviting.

64.name: Patio.
desc: A huge patio overlooks the lawn area.  There are enough tables and
chairs for a party of 100.  The tables and chairs are ornate and
expensive, tasteful and elegant.  Stairs lead up to the main
house.

65.name: Long stairway.
desc: This stairway is suspended on clouds.  It leads from the house to
the front lawn.  The banisters are made of ornate gold and silver
inlays.

66.name: Front door
desc: You stand at the front door of an immense, sprawling mansion made
of granite and marble.  The door is at least 10 feet high and is
made of oak.

exits.desc: You see an ornate oak door.

67.name: Lawn northwest of house.
desc: You stand just outside the northwest corner of the house.  You try
to peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

68.name: Lawn west of house.
desc: You stand just outside the west corner of the house.  You try to
peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

69.name: Lawn southwest of house.
desc: You stand just outside the southwest corner of the house.  You try
to peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

70.name: Lawn south of house.
desc: You stand just outside the south corner of the house.  You try to
peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

71.name: Lawn southeast of house.
desc: You stand just outside the southeast corner of the house.  You try
to peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

72.name: Lawn east of house.
desc: You stand just outside the east corner of the house.  You try to
peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

73.name: Lawn northeast of house.
desc: You stand just outside the northeast corner of the house.  You try
to peek in a window, but it is a little too high to see anything.

74.name: Dirty, dusty tunnel.
74.desc: This dirty dusty tunnel must lead somewhere.

75.name: Basement.
desc: This seems like your average basement.  Old Christmas decorations,
suitcases, bicycles litter your way.  You hear the squeaking of
rats in the corners.

76.name: Bottom of the stairs.
desc: You stand at the bottom of a long staircase leading up to the main
house.  To the south you can barely make out the accumulated
clutter gathered throughout the years.

77.name: Foyer.
desc: ""Magnificent" does not even begin to describe the foyer.  Lavishly
decorated, yet elegant, it gives an impression of indescribable
wealth.  Paintings and tapestries line the walls depicting scenes
from throughout history.  Antiques furnitures and oriental rugs are
tastefully placed in ideal spots.  The door is at least 10 feet
high and is made of oak.

exits.desc: You see an ornate oak door.

78.name: Elegant hallway.
desc: You are in a long, sprawling hallway connecting the eastern and
western wings of the house.  There are several chairs and sofas in
the hallway and some gorgeous, handwoven drapes.

79.name: Library
desc: You are overwhelmed by the sheer volumes of books here.  The
shelves stretch all the way to the ceiling and are on every wall,
even above the doorway.  There are chairs for sitting and reading
and a desk for more intense studies.

80.name: Arboretum.
desc: A small indoor garden so that the residents don't have to go
outside to enjoy plants and commune with nature.  There are several
trees, a small pond and flowers of every kind.

81.name: Western tower.
desc: You are in the bottom part of a tower.  A draft brings a chill to
your spine and causes creaks and groans.  Curtains flutter in the
wind, causing quite a distraction.  When you go to shut the window,
you see that the window is closed.  An old, wooden staircase leads
up into darkness.

82.name: Western tower.
desc: The tower creaks and groans, almost as if it were muttering to
itself.  There are windows displaying a full moon, reigning over
the night sky.  The room is dark and there is almost a musty odor
to it.  You are surprised that you can't detect any dust or dirt,
although there are a couple of cobwebs in the corner.

83.name: Elegant hallway.
desc: You are in a long, sprawling hallway connecting the eastern and
western wings of the house.  There are several chairs and sofas in
the hallway and some gorgeous, handwoven drapes.

84.name: Conservatory
desc: Here was the rehearsal and recital room for the residents of the
estate.  There is a Steinway piano in the corner and various gilded
instruments are on display in a glass cabinet.

85.name: Office
desc: You find youself in a lavish office.  The desk is absolutely huge,
at least ten feet by five feet and made of ebony and inlaid with
mother of pearl.  A grandfather clock towers over the room,
mechanically ticking and tocking the hours away.

86.name: Eastern tower.
desc: You are in the bottom part of a tower.  A draft brings a chill to
your spine and causes creaks and groans.  Curtains flutter in the
wind, causing quite a distraction.  When you go to shut the window,
you see that the window is closed.  An old, wooden staircase leads
up into darkness.

87.name: Eastern tower.
desc: The tower creaks and groans, almost as if it were muttering to
itself.  There are windows displaying a full moon, reigning over
the night sky.  The room is dark and there is almost a musty odor
to it.  You are surprised that you can't detect any dust or dirt,
although there are a couple of cobwebs in the corner.

99.name: Mid-Air.
desc: You slide down the moisture covered rock, gaining speed as you
approach the cliff.  Realizing your foolish error, you madly claw
at the rock, vainly trying to get a precious hold and save your
worthless hide.  Next time, heed your conscience.
